snippet: The Bedlam theater troupe, with a cast of four, is staging George Bernard Shaw’s “St. Joan” at the Access Theater.
abstract: Eric Grode reviews Bedlam theater troupe production of George Bernard Shaw play Saint Joan, directed and performed by Eric Tucker, with additional performances by Ted Lewis and Tom O'Keefe, at the Access Theater. Photo (M)1
lead_paragraph: What a rare and rich treat to see a group of performers stretch the classics as far as possible and not one inch further. That's what the misleadingly named Bedlam company has done with its taut, maraudingly high-spirited take on George Bernard Shaw's ''Saint Joan'' at the Access Theater. A protean quartet has created a production to be treasured: just three gifted men play the 23 fighters, schemers, moralizers and executioners surrounding Joan of Arc (the no-less-gifted Andrus Nichols).

headline.main: Shaw's View of a Woman Headed to a Burning Stake
